results.doc_title: PRD: Enabling One-Time-Purchase (OTP) Capabilities for HelloFresh Group
results.project_name: Enabling One-Time-Purchase (OTP) Capabilities for HelloFresh Group
results.summary: This initiative delivers One-Time-Purchase capability across HelloFresh Group brands, allowing customers to purchase items without requiring an active subscription. Initial 2025 rollouts include Seasonal Boxes, Good Chop offerings, and Factor Form items, with 2026 expansion to 2-Way Marketplace and Factor meal cross-selling.

must_have: Seamless OTP user flow within each participating brand's digital platform
Clear product discovery for OTP-eligible items
Transparent pricing and benefits display
Distinct OTP cart and checkout processes
Order management for new and existing customers (subscribed, paused, or cancelled)
Delivery management capabilities
Payment processing without storing payment details (using payment tokens)
Analytics and data tracking identifiable as OTP
Tax compliance (GST/Goods and Service Fee handling for AU/NZ)
CRM exclusion logic (prevent duplicate promotional emails to customers who already purchased)
Guest checkout capability
Ability to prefill account, delivery and payment information for existing customers
nice_to_have: Integration with existing loyalty program benefits for seasonal boxes
Individual landing pages per seasonal offering
out_of_scope: Creating additional add-on menus or calling separate menus unnecessarily

decisions.what: Use payment token reference instead of storing payment details
decisions.rationale: Payment details are never stored in the HF system for security compliance

decisions.what: Separate payment processing for OTP similar to HelloFresh Market (HFM)
decisions.rationale: Customers ordering both subscription and OTP items need separate payment handling

decisions.what: Phased rollout approach: 2025 initiatives first, then 2026 potential targets
decisions.rationale: Allows for piloting and iteration before broader expansion

technical: Analytics platform for OTP data tracking
team: Dependent Tribes and alliances (referenced in Dependency Tab)

success_metrics: Forecasting accuracy vs business case assumptions

results.doc_title: PRD: Enabling One-Time-Purchase (OTP) Capabilities for HelloFresh Group
results.project_name: Enabling One-Time-Purchase (OTP) Capabilities for HelloFresh Group
results.summary: This initiative delivers One-Time-Purchase capability across HelloFresh Group brands, allowing customers to purchase items like seasonal boxes, Good Chop products, and Factor meals without requiring an active subscription. The solution creates seamless OTP user flows including product discovery, checkout processes, order management, and delivery capabilities for both new and existing customers.

must_have: Seamless OTP user flow within each participating brand's digital platform
Clear product discovery for OTP-eligible items
Transparent pricing and benefits display
Distinct OTP cart and checkout processes
Order management for new and existing customers (subscribed, paused, or cancelled)
Delivery management capabilities
Payment processing (separate from subscription payments)
Data and analytics tracking for OTP transactions
Guest checkout capability
Ability to prefill account, delivery and payment information for existing customers
Tax compliance (GST for AU/NZ markets)
CRM exclusion logic (prevent duplicate promotional emails to customers who already purchased)
nice_to_have: Integration with existing loyalty program benefits for seasonal boxes
Individual landing pages per seasonal offering
out_of_scope: Creating new add-on menus or calling additional menus unnecessarily

decisions.what: Payment handling as separate transaction from subscription
decisions.rationale: Similar to how HelloFresh Market (HFM) is currently charged, OTP would be a separate payment for customers who may also be ordering a regular subscription box

decisions.what: Use payment token reference instead of storing payment details
decisions.rationale: Payment details are never stored in the HF system, so 'use existing payment' would reference a payment token

decisions.what: Phased rollout approach starting with 2025 initiatives
decisions.rationale: Initial pilot with Seasonal Boxes, Good Chop, and Factor Form items before expanding to 2-Way Marketplace and cross-selling in 2026

team: Dependent Tribes and alliances (referenced in Dependency Tab)
external: Good Chop (premium meat and seafood supplier)

success_metrics: Customer engagement across existing, new and past customers
OTP transaction volume and identification in analytics
Waste and ordering accuracy (forecasting concern noted)
Conversion rates for different use cases

results.doc_title: PRD: Enabling One-Time-Purchase (OTP) Capabilities for HelloFresh Group
results.project_name: Enabling One-Time-Purchase (OTP) Capabilities for HelloFresh Group
results.summary: This initiative aims to deliver One-Time-Purchase capabilities across HelloFresh Group brands, enabling customers to purchase products without requiring an active subscription. The solution addresses customer needs for order flexibility and accessibility while opening new engagement channels. Initial 2025 rollouts include Seasonal Boxes, Good Chop offerings, and Factor Form item-based purchases, with potential 2026 expansion to a 2-Way Marketplace and Factor meal cross-selling.

must_have: Seamless OTP user flow within each participating brand's digital platform
Clear product discovery for OTP-eligible items
Transparent pricing and benefits display
Distinct OTP cart and checkout processes
Order management for new and existing customers (subscribed, paused, or cancelled)
Delivery management capabilities
Payment processing with payment token reference support
Analytics and data tracking to identify OTP transactions
Tax compliance (GST/Goods and Service Fee handling for AU/NZ)
Separate payment processing for customers with existing subscriptions
CRM exclusion logic to prevent duplicate promotional emails to previous purchasers
nice_to_have: Ability to use existing loyalty program benefits for seasonal boxes
Prefilled account, delivery and payment information for returning customers
Individual landing pages per seasonal offering
out_of_scope: Storing payment details directly in HF system (will use payment tokens instead)
Creating additional add-on menus or calling separate menus unnecessarily

decisions.what: Use payment token reference instead of storing payment details
decisions.rationale: Payment details are never stored in the HF system for security compliance

decisions.what: Separate payment processing for OTP vs regular subscription boxes
decisions.rationale: Similar to current HFM charging model to maintain clear transaction separation

decisions.what: Phased rollout approach starting with 2025 initiatives before 2026 expansion
decisions.rationale: Allows for piloting and validation before broader marketplace implementation

technical: Analytics platform for OTP data tracking
Tax calculation system for GST compliance
team: Dependent Tribes and alliances (referenced in Dependency Tab)
Forecasting team (for volume planning and waste management)
external: Good Chop (for premium meat and seafood offerings)

success_metrics: OTP transaction volume and identification in analytics
Customer engagement across new, existing, and past customer segments

results.summary: This initiative delivers One-Time-Purchase capability across HelloFresh Group brands, allowing customers to purchase items without requiring an active subscription. Initial 2025 rollouts include Seasonal Boxes, Good Chop offerings, and Factor Form items, with potential 2026 expansion to a 2-Way Marketplace and Factor meal cross-selling.

must_have: Seamless OTP user flow within each participating brand's digital platform
Clear product discovery for OTP-eligible items
Transparent pricing and benefits display
Distinct OTP cart and checkout processes
Order management for new and existing customers (subscribed, paused, or cancelled)
Delivery management capabilities
Payment processing without storing payment details (using payment tokens)
Tax compliance (GST for AU/NZ markets)
Analytics and data tracking identifiable as OTP
CRM exclusion logic (prevent duplicate promotional emails to customers who already purchased)
nice_to_have: Prefilled account, delivery and payment information for existing customers
Integration with loyalty program benefits for seasonal boxes
Individual landing pages per seasonal offering
out_of_scope: Creating additional add-on menus or calling another menu unnecessarily

decisions.what: Structure document in three parts: Summary/Overview, Individual Use Case tabs, and Dependency tabs
decisions.rationale: Provides clear strategic hub and detailed roadmap from use case perspective

decisions.what: Use payment token reference instead of storing payment details
decisions.rationale: Payment details are never stored in HF system for security/compliance

decisions.what: Pilot OTP capability initially for Seasonal Boxes, Good Chop, and Factor Form
decisions.rationale: Phased approach to validate capability before broader rollout

technical: Analytics platform for OTP data tracking
CRM system for email exclusion logic
team: Dependent Tribes and alliances (referenced in Dependency Tab)

results.target_date: Q1 2026 (March target for launch before Q2)
results.summary: Good Chop is launching a new Shopify-based marketplace to experiment with item-based pricing, offering customers flexible ordering options including one-time purchases and subscriptions. The project aims to gain insights into product uptake, order habits, customer lifetime value, and subscription retention while evaluating operational efficiency and cost-effectiveness of this new channel.

must_have: Item-based pricing model
One-time purchase capability
Shopify storefront implementation
GTM (Google Tag Manager) install for usage tracking
Product ratings and reviews via Yotpo plugin
Support for new customer acquisition
Phase 1: Traditional e-commerce experience with baseline metrics
Phase 2: 'Subscriptions + save' option
Manual financial performance aggregation from Shopify reports
Identical brand identity (logos, colors, fonts) across platforms
nice_to_have: Advanced usage tracking via Shopify plugins
A/B testing capability through Shopify plugins
Customer feedback management through Shopify plugins
out_of_scope: Direct integration with existing HelloFresh dashboards
Restricting access to existing or former subscribers

decisions.what: Use external implementation partner (Anatta) for Shopify setup
decisions.rationale: Ensures streamlined and rapid setup of the Shopify marketplace
Phase 1 establishes baseline with item-based pricing, Phase 2 tests subscription model, Phase 3 determined by results

decisions.what: No restriction on existing customers accessing the storefront
decisions.rationale: Maximize reach and impact across entire customer spectrum while focusing on new customer acquisition

decisions.what: Manual aggregation of financial performance data
decisions.rationale: Minimize integration complexity and alignment overhead with existing systems

decisions.what: Use Yotpo for product ratings and reviews

technical: Shopify plugins for analytics and A/B testing

success_metrics: Performance differences for specific protein cuts
